'''Swords''' was a four-player card game enjoyed in [[northwest Faer√ªn]] ''circa'' the [[1372 DR|Year of Wild Magic, 1372 DR]]. It was often a gambling game and was offered at the [[High Flagon]] gambling hall and inn just outside [[Waterdeep]].{{Cite dragon/302/Elminster's Guide to the Realms: The High Flagon|77}}
document_data.Set-Up and Play: The game of Swords used a 25-card deck made of four suits of six cards each, plus one card called the Throne or Castle.The source goes no further in describing this game, saying only that it was "essentially [[wikipedia:en:Euchre|euchre]]" with the addition of the extra card that "outranks the Ace". This roughly corresponds to the British [[wikipedia:en:Euchre game variations#Four players|variation]] of the game that adds a "Benny" (in Australia it was known as the "Bird") card that takes on the trump suit once trump has been chosen. Note that the Benny outranks all other trump cards, but the Throne or Castle only outranks the ace (which is the third-highest trump in standard euchre).
